content:
This is a cool, original clash. But I think the wording is a bit unclear.

It would be good to clarify that 'upside-down' really means 'rotated by 180 degrees', I got this in a clash and spent time first just assuming that all the keys were swapped so that Q<->Z, W<->X, etc.

Also you say the middle row is "ASDFGHJKL;456 (even if it's upside down)", but that's a bit misleading, because once it's rotated 180 degrees it becomes ";LKJHGFDSA654". I think that line is part of what led me to think it was just a vertical mirroring of the keys rather than a rotation.

I came first of 4 in my clash, finishing in 5m18s. 2/4 got 0% and 1/4 got 50%. I think clarifying the wording could help make it more solvable. https://www.codingame.com/clashofcode/clash/report/37890735b2861cd6dad5b05dced06b3c664646b

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I find it original, well-described, and relatively easy!
Upvoted and approved, funny to implement by rolling your head on the keyboard to create the mapping to upside-down keys ahah

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Cool concept, looks fun and the goal is well described.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good idea, not so hard to implement either.
I suggest clarifying that input will never contain both 0 and * (I was wondering whether to flip or not if that were the case)

EDITS:

-Updated wording around "Keyboard/Numpad" to maintain that the two are separate, but when upside down, are both upside down.

-Added Comments to solution code

-5DN1L's suggestions were taken into account and applied. TY!

Goal
* Suggest to delete the double quotation marks in the first paragraph.

* Do you mean "QWERTY" instead of "QUERTY"?

* Please format "ASDFGHJKL;456", "0", "TYUI", "NBVC", "10155", "9*955", "lmao", "sr;x" and "*" as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks.

* Suggest to convert the third example into uppercase to avoid confusion.

* You mention that the numpad and the keyboard are separate, and then you also mention that the keyboards may be turned upside down. So, the numpads are NOT turned upside down?

Constraints
* Please format the special characters as {{constants}} instead of `monospace`, and also remove the quotation marks.

* Please delete the empty third constraint.

Thanks.

Thanks for the feedback!
*Agreed, they're not really necessary.

* Yes! typo on QWERTY

*Done :)

*Agreed, the input and output should both only be uppercase, so thank you for the suggestion on this oversight!

*Specified all instances of "keyboard" to be "keyboard and numpad", and added a hint to specify that if one is upside down, so is the other.

*modified both of the constraints, thanks again!

added a bit to the Input section, thanks for the suggestion :)

Hinted at this in the goal, with "is only upside down if it contains *" and stating that the intended order number is only supposed to be alphanumeric. However, there's a lot of wordplay in the goal that dances around giving the clasher the explicit logic, so I think it's good to specify in the input section

Added a mention that upside down = 180 degrees in the first mention of "Upside Down", then clarified on the mention of the middle row, that it would be ";LKJHGFDSA654" if upside down. I also added a space and clarified that the keyboard and numpad are separate within that first paragraph.

Thanks for the feedback :)
Nice, I think this should be easier to understand now. :)

No problem!

Two points on the updated clash:

Goal
* Please format "ASDFGHJKL;456" as a {{constant}} and remove the quotation marks.

* In the last sentence, please change "they" to "the".

Thanks again.
